name: Violin - CSS
description: Cinematic Studio Strings Violin. Bright, expressive tone with rich overtones. Ideal for melodic lines and emotional passages.

legato.description: Legato is for MONO parts only - smooth transition between single notes. Enable legato (velocity ≥64) when playing single melodic lines. Disable legato (velocity <64) when 2+ notes sound simultaneously (chords, double stops). Re-enable when returning to mono. Prefer keyswitch over CC for legato control.

orchestration_hints.character: Bright, singing, expressive. The soprano voice of the string section.

register_character.low: G3-D4: Dark, rich, intense. Good for dramatic moments.
register_character.mid: D4-A5: Sweet, singing, most expressive range. Ideal for melodies.
register_character.high: A5-E7: Brilliant, piercing, emotional. Use for climaxes.

ensemble_tips: Doubles well with flute or oboe at octave
In string ensemble, typically carries the melody
Can provide harmonic padding with tremolo
avoid: Very low sustained notes (use viola/cello instead)
Competing with brass in same register during loud passages

ai.system_prompt_template: Generate violin parts for Cinematic Studio Strings. Use CC1 for dynamics on long articulations, velocity for short articulations. LEGATO: Keyswitch Ab1 toggles legato (velocity ≥64 on, <64 off). IMPORTANT: Legato is for MONO parts only - use it for smooth note-to-note transitions in single melodic lines. Disable legato before any chords or double stops (2+ simultaneous notes), re-enable when returning to mono melody. Switch articulations via CC58. Playable range G3-E7, preferred G3-B6.
